New Records: Phoenix Suns improved to 8-1 for the first time since the 2009-10 season
Key Match Events: Jusuf Nurkic made a decisive free throw with 0.8 seconds left after being fouled on an offensive rebound
Daniel Gafford tied the game with an alley-oop dunk from Luka Doncic
Royce O'Neale missed a runner in the final seconds, but Nurkic grabbed the rebound and was fouled
Luka Doncic had 30 points, seven assists, and seven rebounds
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns' bench outscored the Dallas bench 28-9 after a 23-9 edge in the first meeting
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phoenix didn't have a huge edge in offensive rebounds at 11-8, but six of them came in the fourth quarter
Nurkic had all three of his offensive rebounds in the fourth quarter
Others: Upcoming games: Phoenix faces Sacramento on Sunday, and Dallas plays Denver on Sunday night
